verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Hadrach <S%H2317><s%>, and Damascus <S%H1834><s%> shall be the rest <S%H4496><s%> there <S%H5869><s%>: when the eyes of man <S%H120><s%>, as of all the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, shall be toward the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
And Hamath <S%H2574><s%> also shall border <S%H1379><s%> thereby <S%H6865><s%>; Tyrus, and Zidon <S%H6721><s%>, though it be very <S%H3966><s%> wise <S%H2449><s%>.

And Tyrus <S%H6865><s%> did build <S%H1129><s%> herself a strong hold <S%H4692><s%>, and heaped up <S%H6651><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%>, and fine gold <S%H2742><s%> as the mire <S%H2916><s%> of the streets <S%H2351><s%>.

Behold <S%H136><s%>, the Lord will cast her out <S%H3423><s%>, and he will strike <S%H5221><s%> her power <S%H2428><s%> in the sea <S%H3220><s%>; and she shall be devoured <S%H398><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>.

Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H3372><s%>, and fear; Gaza <S%H5804><s%> also shall see it <S%H3966><s%>, and be very sorrowful <S%H2342><s%>, and Ekron <S%H6138><s%>; for her expectation <S%H4007><s%> shall be ashamed <S%H3001><s%>; and the king <S%H4428><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%> from Gaza <S%H5804><s%>, and Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> shall not be inhabited <S%H3427><s%>.
And a bastard <S%H4464><s%> shall live <S%H3427><s%> in Ashdod <S%H795><s%>, and I will cut off <S%H3772><s%> the pride <S%H1347><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>.

And I will take away <S%H5493><s%> his blood <S%H1818><s%> out of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and his abominations <S%H8251><s%> from between his teeth <S%H8127><s%>: but he that remains <S%H7604><s%>, even he <S%H430><s%>, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor <S%H441><s%> in Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and Ekron <S%H6138><s%> as a Jebusite <S%H2983><s%>.

And I will encamp <S%H2583><s%> about my house <S%H1004><s%> because of the army <S%H4675><s%>, because of him that passes by <S%H5674><s%>, and because of him that returns <S%H7725><s%>: and no oppressor <S%H5065><s%> shall pass through <S%H5674><s%> them any more <S%H7200><s%>: for now have I seen with my eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

Rejoice <S%H1523><s%> greatly <S%H3966><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>; shout <S%H7321><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: behold <S%H4428><s%>, your King comes <S%H935><s%> unto you <S%H6662><s%>: he is just, and having salvation <S%H3467><s%>; lowly <S%H6041><s%>, and riding <S%H7392><s%> upon a donkey <S%H2543><s%>, and upon a colt <S%H5895><s%> the foal <S%H1121><s%> of a donkey <S%H860><s%>.

And I will cut off <S%H3772><s%> the chariot <S%H7393><s%> from Ephraim <S%H669><s%>, and the horse <S%H5483><s%> from Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, and the battle <S%H4421><s%> bow <S%H7198><s%> shall be cut off <S%H3772><s%>: and he shall speak <S%H1696><s%> peace <S%H7965><s%> unto the heathen <S%H1471><s%>: and his dominion <S%H4915><s%> shall be from sea <S%H3220><s%> even to sea <S%H3220><s%>, and from the river <S%H5104><s%> even to the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.
As for you also <S%H1818><s%>, by the blood of your covenant <S%H1285><s%> I have sent forth <S%H7971><s%> your prisoners <S%H615><s%> out of the pit <S%H953><s%> where is no water <S%H4325><s%>.

Turn <S%H7725><s%> you to the strong hold <S%H1225><s%>, you prisoners <S%H615><s%> of hope <S%H8615><s%>: even to day <S%H3117><s%> do I declare <S%H5046><s%> that I will render <S%H7725><s%> double unto you <S%H4932><s%>;

When I have bent <S%H1869><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> for me <S%H4390><s%>, filled the bow <S%H7198><s%> with Ephraim <S%H669><s%>, and raised up <S%H5782><s%> your sons <S%H1121><s%>, O Zion <S%H6726><s%>, against your sons <S%H1121><s%>, O Greece <S%H3120><s%>, and made <S%H7760><s%> you as the sword <S%H2719><s%> of a mighty man <S%H1368><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> shall be seen <S%H7200><s%> over them <S%H2671><s%>, and his arrow shall go forth <S%H3318><s%> as the lightning <S%H1300><s%>: and the Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%> shall blow <S%H8628><s%> the trumpet <S%H7782><s%>, and shall go <S%H1980><s%> with whirlwinds <S%H5591><s%> of the south <S%H8486><s%>.

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> shall defend <S%H1598><s%> them <S%H398><s%>; and they shall devour, and subdue <S%H3533><s%> with sling <S%H7050><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>; and they shall drink <S%H8354><s%>, and make a noise <S%H1993><s%> as through wine <S%H3196><s%>; and they shall be filled <S%H4390><s%> like bowls <S%H4219><s%>, and as the corners <S%H2106><s%> of the altar <S%H4196><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> their God <S%H430><s%> shall save <S%H3467><s%> them in that day <S%H3117><s%> as the flock <S%H6629><s%> of his people <S%H5971><s%>: for they shall be as the stones <S%H68><s%> of a crown <S%H5145><s%>, lifted up as a ensign <S%H5264><s%> upon his land <S%H127><s%>.

For how great is his goodness <S%H2898><s%>, and how great is his beauty <S%H3308><s%>! corn <S%H1715><s%> shall make the young men <S%H970><s%> cheerful <S%H5107><s%>, and new wine <S%H8492><s%> the maids <S%H1330><s%>.
